Men are only free to roam the island if they are wearing chastity belts and if they remove their belts they get castrated. Its all out war when the men try abolish the women only baby rule.—horror69

Title: Return of the Sentimental Swordsman
Synopsis: Many feel that this, one of the Shaw Studio's biggest moneymakers, is one of those rare sequels which superior to its original. In any case, the charming title hero is back in action, facing the Money Clan Chief for the fate of the "Martial Arts World".

Title: Dhanwan
Synopsis: Vijay Kumar Saxena is a rich playboy who cares about nothing he falls in love with Asha Nath who she ignore as she is in love with Anil due to an accident committed by Anil Vijay lost his eyesight and needs eyes donation to see again Anil dies and donating his eyes to Vijay who after that shows tremendous change in his behaviour and way of life but will he be able to live his new life forever? will he be able to win Asha hurt especially after she knew about Anil donation?—old is gold

Title: Pruncul, petrolul si Ardelenii
Synopsis: The three Brad brothers want to return to Romania, but one of them gets married and they buy a farm. Unfortunately for them, the neighbors are Hungarian, and they become enemies.

Title: Showbiz Scandal
Synopsis: THE FILM DISSECTS THE ANATOMY OF A TYPICAL SANDAL ON LOCAL SHOW BUSINESS.

Title: The Weapons of Death
Synopsis: In San Francisco's Chinatown, a band of thugs kidnaps a girl for a large Chinese gang. Her half-brother gathers a team of expert fighters to get her back. In San Francisco's Chinatown, Eric runs a martial arts school. His skills come in handy when a band of thugs kidnaps his half-sister for a large Chinese gang. The head thug took the job because he has a score to settle with the girl's father. The Chinese gang wants ransom money from the girl's mother, who, despite living modestly, has enough to pay it. Eric gathers a team of expert fighters from his school and goes off to get the girl back. But emotions run high when the team is joined by the father who had left his family years ago. Later, they'll be joined by a kidnapper with a conscience. In the hills, the girl escapes and gets recaptured several times. The hills are teeming not only with the members of the Chinese gang, but with female assassins and cruel bikers, too.—J. Spurlin

Title: Lisova pisnya. Mavka
Synopsis: Mavka, a water nymph, loves Lukash, a country youth. Their brief happiness ends when Lukash is forced to marry the shrewish Kilina. The Spirit of the Forest turns Lukash into a wolf as punishment for his infidelity. The strength of Mavka's love breaks the spell, but Kilina curses the nymph, transforming her into a weeping willow. This beautiful and tragic story is based on a play written in 1912 by Lesya Ukrainka, a Ukrainian poet, writer and political, civil and female activist, and includes mythological characters taken from Ukrainian folklore.

Title: Pepe, no me des tormento
Synopsis: Mario has to write a screenplay for a movie and calls his friend Pepe, a weird collaborator. Mario lives with Bárbara, a divorced American, and his 3 sons, but in his house he can't write. That's why he decides to go with Pepe to a friend's house to write the screenplay. But there they find a bank thief who knows Pepe from a previous "business".—Daniel Romero <aiamano17@yahoo.es>

Title: Laylat Shetaa Dafe'a
Synopsis: Rich Girl Sarah has married against her father's wishes and manages to get away from him by jumping off the yacht. While her father send his men to track her down, she tries to make her way back to her husband. She starts out on a bus where she meets newly unemployed journalist Mamdouh. He's quickly onto her real identity and it's pretty obvious that she's a spoiled brat. She has no money and he decides to help her get where she wants thinking he'll get a good story out of it. As they travel together however, they develop an appreciation and an understanding of one another. It soon turns to love.—Akram Gus

Title: Savaal
Synopsis: Brothers Shankar and Raja decide to go to the city for better opportunities post their mother's death. However, they get separated while travelling on a goods train. Sankar and Raja are brothers who lost their mother and becomes orphans. For their survival, they plan to go to city via goods train. However at a junction, they got split and hence their lives. Sankar grows to be a great smuggler while raja becomes a petty criminal for pick pocketing. Radha a wealthy girls falls in love in Raja. However twists and turns were introduced between them. How Sankar and raja gets united is the story.—Film Review Bala

Title: Deadly Commando
Synopsis: American ambassador is kidnapped by terrorists after an accident with the plane that was taking him to the Philippines, for a special mission.

Title: Bihagin: Bilibid Boys
Synopsis: This action-drama film dissects the cases of seven youths in conflict with the law. The movie portrays seven wayward men who suffer within the walls of the national penitentiary. They serve their sentences as if they are living their regular free, luxurious lives outside the cold bars of the prison, in open air, able to go where they want when they want. Four of the men--Nandong (Al Tantay), Noel (Mark Gil), Butch (Gabby Concepcion), and Caloy (Choy Acuña)--are gay men who feel attracted to Steve Guanzon (Alfie Anido) and eventually sodomize and rape him.—Gay Pinoy Soldier

Title: Pétrole! Pétrole!
Synopsis: An Arab emir, emir Abdullah, finds his lost daughter who becomes the new heiress to his fortune. She is however married to Bernard Bérian, an oil speculator, who is a competitor and worst enemy of the emir's largest client, Jean-Marie Tardel, crooked CEO of G.A.P., the main oil company in France. The struggle to become the largest oil importer in the country will be ruthless.

Title: Kenn' ich, weiß ich, war ich schon!
Muz pres palubu
Synopsis: Ten-year-old David joins a sailing club. He trains hard and helps repair the sailing boats, but people have to take turns actually sailing. The club chairman Vala wants David to sail with his son Olda. Olda's previous team mate Béda has grown too fast, but with little David Olda could win a place on the regatta to Finland. Olda is arrogant and accustomed to winning with little effort; he bullies David and calls him "Greenhorn". He makes David his servant and blames him when things go wrong.—NFA.cz

Title: Hitman in the Hand of Buddha
Synopsis: A country bumpkin arrives to help his brother's rice business. Things get out of hand while a rival company becomes corrupt. The bumpkin, an ace martial artist, fights off the rivals with the aid of some Buddhist guidence... A country bumpkin arrives to help his brother's rice business. Things get out of hand while a rival company becomes corrupt. The bumpkin, an ace martial artist, fights off the rivals. Angered, the rivals hire a martial arts expert to fight the hero, only to get beaten up himself. The expert send his teacher to hurt the hero and succeeds. The hero is sent to a temple where he learns a new style of kung fu. Now with the skills, our hero is ready to get even.—Ninja01

Title: The Island of Adventure
Synopsis: Four British teens on vacation visit an island and discover that a terrorist group is using it as their headquarters.

Title: The Imperial Navy
Synopsis: A lavish retelling of the true story of the final voyage and ultimate destruction and sinking of the battleship Yamato, Japan's greatest flagship during the Second World War.—Guy Mariner Tucker

Title: Lustful Life: Night Make Me Wet!
Le maître d'école
Synopsis: After having lost his job for having saved a child accused of shop lifting, Frédéric Barbier decides to become a school teacher with some funny results.The great comedy actor Coluche is excellent as a simple school teacher.

Title: Legend of the Wild
Synopsis: Patchwork movie edited from episodes from the TV seriesThe Life and Times of Grizzly Adams (1977).

Title: No Mercy, No Future
Synopsis: Doctors say that Veronika, a woman in her 20s, is schizophrenic. She is compliant, which makes her an easy target for men. She's religious, believing she is God's favorite child; she searches for Jesus. She has sent a letter to a filmmaker suggesting her life as the subject for a movie. We see her raped than take up with a series of men she believes are Jesus, each willing or insistent on sex. A young man with his own crisis of faith invites her to join a cult. We see her involuntarily committed to an asylum from time to time where medication and constraints await. Her wealthy parents are helpless. Will a medical professional ever talk to her? If one did, would it help?—<jhailey@hotmail.com> A young and mentally disturbed woman develops a Christ fixation and wanders around Berlin only to become exploited or abused by all who come into contact with her. Apparently based on letters written by a schizophrenic woman that had been received by Sanders-Brahms.

Title: Camera d'albergo
Synopsis: A pair of young filmmakers have secretly, over a year, filmed the goings-on in a hotel room, trying to realize a "live act" of regular people living their lives. They get in touch with old, money-tight producer Mengaroni to edit their film, but while they contact the accidental actors to gather authorization, Mengaroni starts to manipulate their work.—Alessio F. Bragadini <alessio@dsnet.it>

Title: 357 magnum
Synopsis: Two detective brothers look for the criminals who killed their brother, as they catch drug dealers and interrogate thugs in the name of the law.

Title: The Kaleidoscope
Synopsis: A young ebullient and sensitive Calcuttan meets the editor of a leading newspaper and is assigned to 'do' a newsy yet intimate story of his own middle class milieu within two days. The young man, endowed with erratic enthusiasm, sets every bit of situation he comes across to critical analysis, but fails to build a wholesome reportage. Utterly desperate, he even acts as catalyst but with no tangible effect. In a confused state of mind he dreams an absurd dream full of fury and a deep annoyance at the bourgeoisie. What follows is a second meeting with the editor and an inevitable compromise.—Swarup Basak

Title: Illalu
Synopsis: Watch the full movie, Illalu online, only on Eros Now. Illalu is the movie which reflects the fact about the original identity of a married women's life.Kiran (Shoban Babu) and Kalpana (Jayasudha) are married and they even have a son.Kalpana is a very irresponsible and care-free woman who thinks that her husband and her son are a big obstacle for her happy life.She wants to enjoy her life with lots of money, without having responsibilities.So she leaves her son and husband and marries an old man for money.In the meanwhile, Kiran meets Jyoti (Sridevi) and they both get married.Jyoti also accepts Kiran's son.But unexpectedly they meet Kalpana who has now understood her fault and wants her son back.What will Kiran do in this situation? To which mother will he give justice, forms the rest of the story.

Title: Rivals
Synopsis: After the death of his father, Adam moves (with his family) from their sheep farm in Wyoming to Los Angeles. Soon after arriving, Adam gets mixed up with Clyde, a mannerless bully who enjoys pulling pranks on Adam and putting him down for his rural image. Adam, in turn, gets back at Clyde on a number of occasions, and the two soon become rivals. When Clyde starts taking a fancy to Adam's sister, and his girfriend starts hanging out with Adam, relations between the two rapidly come to a head.—Jean-Marc Rocher <rocher@fiberbit.net>

Title: Fat Chance
Synopsis: An overweight man and woman become penpals but are too embarrassed to send each other photographs of themselves and instead exchange pictures of two thinner people. Comedic complications arise when the two penpals finally arrange to meet in person.—Anonymous

Title: Teacher Kemal
Synopsis: Kemal a simple teacher arrives in a remote village to start a new school and teach the young ones, when he gets there he faces a strong opposition to his idea by the village master. Kemal with the help of few villagers tries to fight back the ignorance and oppression to give a hope for the poor people of the village.—Moh X

Title: Ski Mistress
Synopsis: The young and sensual Celia Berni is an Italian model that is about to inherit a large sum of money from her American uncle. The condition is that she must show an exceptional moral conduct.

Title: Que no me bese el mariachi
Une sale affaire
Synopsis: Novak is a police inspector to whom any means is fair in getting evidence on criminals - especially drug dealers. He is after a drug ring that includes a city official and desperately needs evidence to bring the corrupt politician to trial, and to close down the ring.—morroviolet

Title: Kamakalawa
Synopsis: HIGH ADVENTURE - DEATHLESS PASSION...AIDESOME SPECTACLE...WHEN ALL OUR SWEETEST DREAMS WERE TRUE THE DAY BEFORE YESTERDAY

Title: Play it, Boogie-Woogie
Synopsis: A young cat burglar begins a love triangle with a reckless older man and her on-again/off-again bonehead biker boyfriend.

Title: Beyond the Universe
Synopsis: A 21st-century scientist tries to save Earth after two atomic wars.

Title: Dead Certain
Synopsis: Two great friends who practice cycling, Commissioner Servolle and real estate developer Faguet, see their friendship tested by the investigation carried out following the murder of Faguet's wife. Commissioner Servolle (Claude Brasseur), 40, is the undisputed ace of the criminal. He is a man who knows how to impose himself wherever he goes and better yet, to make himself loved: One day, another happiness arrives: friendship. The chosen one is called Faguet (Jean-Louis Trintignant), a famous architect always happy and full of humor. But this event falls perfectly well to boost the morale of Servolle, because for 8 months, he has been trampling on the case of the killer of the beautiful neighborhoods: a maniac who coldly slaughters women. He has already knocked three times and the fourth is terrible because she is Faguet's own wife. Servolle is now at the start of the track. He knows he will have the killer. But suppose that Faguet at the beginning of their friendship introduced him to his mistress as his legitimate wife, suppose that he was once a sniper, and that in the Faguet couple, hatred had reigned for years. A long nightmare will then begin for Servolle. If he kept a bit of lucidity, he would compare it to a desperation of love or, perhaps worse, friendship.

Title: Unutulmayanlar
Synopsis: A group of lorry drivers get in trouble with the law and are forced to become fugitives.

Title: Saptapadhi
Synopsis: Somayajulu, an orthodox high-priest of a village temple weds his grand-daughter Hema to his grand-son Gaurinatha, also a priest by profession, without realising that she is in love with Murali, a Harijan. Hema is a professional dancer who gives performances along with her father's troupe, while Murali plays flute in the troupe. Gaurinatha marries Hema, but only succeeds to see the goddess he worships, in Hema. He learns the truth from Hema and decides to unite her with Murali. After much deliberations, Yajulu not only gives consent, but actively carries it out in the face of stiff resistance from the village.—PARTHU3

Title: The Shinobi Ninja
Synopsis: Fighters hired to steal back a secret document that if public could destroy all democracy.

Title: Black Jack
Synopsis: Sir Thomas Bedford orchestrates the heist of a Spanish casino, with the aid of a singer performing there. The police are aware of their activities, and a hostage situation arises.

Title: Kadal Meengal
Synopsis: Fisherman Selvam and Bhagyam are separated by fate. Selvam becomes a powerful man in the city while Bhagyam raises their son, Rajan, who learns about his father's betrayal and seeks revenge. Selvam averts a mishap and returns to his village to find his lover Bhagyam. Unable to find Bhagyam and unaware of her life in isolation, he marries another woman. But time springs a surprise and his own son turns into his biggest foe. Tied down by broken promises, what does the future hold for them ?

Title: V nebe 'Nochnye vedmy'
Synopsis: This war film tells about the feat of Soviet women-pilots, who during the WWII, mostly at night, bombed the positions of German-fascist troops and enemy communications. The Germans were horrified at the sudden appearance of Soviet light U-2 airplanes at night, and they began to call them "Night Witches".

Title: Does the Cuckoo Sing at Night?
People Only Live Once
Synopsis: The coincidence between the doctor Amal, who decided to move away from Cairo in the isolation of optional Saloum in an attempt to escape the anniversary of the death of her fiance in a car accident, and the schoolboy playboy gambling Hani, who was transferred to Saloum as punishment for his disdain and misconduct, meet the train and the emergence of signs of admiration develops for love after multiple Meeting with them on the beach of Salloum, while they meet a different model of human beings in the workplace, and meet Hany Bakidi Bakri fleeing revenge, and meet the hope of the doctor Tariq, who tries to harass and exploit the unity, is the development of love and grow amid these things and circumstances interlocking?

Title: Agni Pareeksha
Synopsis: Mentally unstable Alok runs away on the eve of his wedding and falls in love with his friend Siddharth's fiancee. Then Alok is murdered and Siddharth becomes the prime suspect. When her former lover, Anupam, returns to her life, her husband kills himself, and after this sudden suicide, Karuna Choudhary must not only look after the household; their family business, but must also admit her only child a son, Alok, in a mental hospital. Now she has met with an accident and has been confined to bed and any movement is by wheelchair. Things change for her when she hires a Secretary/Nurse/Governess in Meeta. She is so pleased with Meeta that she like her to be her daughter-in-law when her now grown-up and cured son, returns home. But Alok does not return, instead runs away to Bombay. An anxious Karuna asks her Manager, Siddharth Sharma, to locate him and bring him back home, which he does. Alok is unhappy at home, but when he meets Meeta he falls head over heels in love with her and wants to marry her. The only problem is Meeta is in love with Siddharth, and wants to marry him. Then everyone's lives are turned upside down when Alok is shot dead with a gun that has Siddharth's fingerprints on them. Siddharth is arrested by the police on the day he weds Meeta, charged with Alok's murder and theft of valuables from the Choudhary household, tried in court, found guilty, and sentenced to be hanged, and only a miracle can now save Siddharth from the gallows.—rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com) Alok is the only son of millionaire Mrs. Karona Ranjeet. For the past few years he was a mental case. However, he recovered after a hard work by Dr. Sen. Karona and his brother, decide to get him married but the doctor says that the girls whom Alok marries should completely dissolve her personality into Alok because such people become quite possessive after treatment. In the while, Alok runs out of the town and goes to Bombay. Keeping in mind that he will not return with his Uncle, Karona sends her new manager, Mr. Siddarth, to take him back home. Siddarth goes to Bombay and takes Alok back to town. Meanwhile, Alok gets attached with Siddarth so much that he does not want him to leave for just a minute and so with his friend, Meeta. Meeta is an orphan brought up by Mrs. Karona. Meeta and Siddarth love each other but during the while, Alok also falls in love with Meeta and wants to marry her. Meeta is very kind of Mrs. Karona and does not want to hurt her by refusing to marry Alok but she loves Siddarth. However, she gets engaged with Alok and Siddarth leaves the town after giving resignation. But Alok recalls him as he comes to know that there was some serious relationship in the past between Meeta and Siddarth. What will that serious possessive psychological case (Alok) do with both of them (Siddarth and Meeta)?—Mohsin Ali Khan

Nina makes a diligent effort to hold down her job as part of a subway cleaning crew and be a good mother to her daughter. She experiences some successes, but also some setbacks. Synopsis: Cruel and lustful Thakur Dayal Singh (Amjad Singh) brutally rapes Sarla (Nazneen), forcing her to commit suicide, leaving her young children, Vikram and Munna, homeless. Vikram and Munna try to stay together but are separated. Years later Vikram (Sanjeev Kumar) has taken to a life of crime with Ranvir, who unknown to Vikram, is none other than Thakur Dayal Singh. While assisting his friend, Peter (Paintal) to meet with his future wife, Ruby (Preeti Ganguly), Vikram meets with the ravishing Priya (Sulakshana Pandit), and both fall in love with each other. His duties lead him to meet many thiefs and criminals, one of whom is the beautiful Soni (Neetu Singh). After a few misunderstandings both fall in love, and Soni pledges to give up her life of crime. Then one day, when Amar is being overwhelmed by a number of gangsters, Vikram comes to his help and both become good friends. This friendship does not last long as Amar soon starts to suspect Vikram. Title: Aszparuh
Synopsis: This is an epic screen presentation showing the creation, the consolidation and the power of First Bulgarian Kingdom and the first Bulgarian ruler Khan Asparuh. The 7th century is the time of the Great Migration of the Peoples. Under the pressure of the invaders the proto-Bulgarian tribes of Khan Kubrat are forced to split in four parts in the hope that one would survive. For twenty long years Kubrat's youngest son Khan Asparoukh led his people across many foreign lands to find eventually a new homeland on the Balkan Peninsula and this time forever. The story is told by Byzantine Velisarius, a hostage with the Bulgarian who witnesses the whole of their difficult march. He sees the suffering of the people whom he already feels close to his heart and the personal drama of their Khan Asparoukh. In 681, in alliance with the local Slav tribes, the proto-Bulgarian deal a decisive blow on numerous Byzantine army, thus 13 centuries ago the foundations of the Bulgarian state and nation were laid down.—Georgi Djulgerov <georgidjul1943@gmail.com>

Title: Vidiyum Vari Kaathiru
Synopsis: Can true love change the heart of even a hardened criminal? This is the question thrown at the audience in 'Vidiyumvarai Kaathiru'. Raja (Bhagyaraj) is a hardened criminal, forever plotting to usurp the property of others. He comes to Ooty and wins the confidence of Rajshekar, a rich businessman. Rajshekar develops so much faith in Raja that he gets him married to his own mentally unstable daughter Satya (Satyakala) and bequeaths all his property in her name. He also adds a clause that in case Satya meets with her death, then all the property would go to Raja. Raja plots and makes several attempts to kill Satya, but always fails. At last, he comes to know that all along, Satya has been aware of his plans. She now begs him to surrender to the police as she is in the family way. Does Raja have a change of heart? Title: I carabbimatti

Title: Croque la vie
Synopsis: The reunion, over the years, of three friends. Alain (Bernard Giraudeau), Catherine (Brigitte Fossey) and Thérèse (Carole Laure) were twenty-six years old in 1973. Inseparable, they have founded a small business together. Sentimental complications intervene. Thérèse wants to marry Franck. A first quarrel breaks out. Alain then reconnects with Anne-Marie and Catherine ends up finding a job in the provinces. 1977. Four years have passed. Catherine lives happily with Jérome. Thérèse, in the process of divorce, is raising her baby and Alain, married with two children, has become a bookseller. We meet again. We introduce ourselves to our new friends. They swear to meet often, but life again makes them drift apart. On a dull day, Alain and Catherine have a real reunion. Therese finally gets a taste of life. They are 35 years old and would like to prove to each other that they haven't changed. They organize a big party like in the past. The day after the party, nothing will be quite the same. And yet, the dreams of youth are still alive.

Title: Mahabali Hanuman
Synopsis: When childless Anjani prayed to Shiva to give her a son, he must have been listening because nine months and a visit from Marut, the God of Wind later, she delivers one -- the young deity Hanuman. As a child Hanuman mischievously tried to swallow the sun, thinking it was a fruit. When he is smote for his unwitting trespass by Indra, king of the Gods, he lays lifeless, only to be resurrected and granted gifts by an assemblage of gods. These gifts along with his own virtues earn him the title of Mahabali, or The Mighty One. His life is the subject of this film, which focuses on both his childhood exploits and adult adventures.—Ray Ban {rbanerji@optonline.net} Bhagwan Shri Shivji appears before Vanar Kanya Anjani and grants her a son through Pavandev, and as a result she gives birth to Pavanputra Hanuman, who has magical powers, including the ability to fly, change shapes, and become minute and gigantic instantly. As a child he attains knowledge through Suryadev, and one day playfully swallows the sun, bringing the entire universe into darkness. This angers Devraj Indra, who kills Him. An angered Pavandev brings the universe to a standstill compelling Brahmaji to bring Hanumanji back to life. Devis and Devas like Agnidev, Vishnuji, Shivji, Yamraj, Varundev, Lakshmiji, Parvatiji, appear and shower blessings on the child which make him invincible and immortal. He is also told that he will be devoted to Bhagwan Shri Ram, and spends his entire childhood looking for Him, and does find Him through His brother, Lakshmanji, who was injured by a one-eyed demon. Ramji's wife, Devi Maa Sita, has been abducted by Shivbhakt Ravan, and Hanuman, Vanarraj Sugreev, and others assist Ramji in not only locating and rescuing Sitaji, but also ending Ravanji's tyrannical rule. Sitaji undergoes a Agniparikhsa, and the trio, along with Hanumanji, return to Ayodhya - where Ramji is crowned King. It is here that we will learn why Sindoor and Oil is associated with Hanumanji, why Ramji will be forced to take up arms against Hanumanji as well as view Him in his true celestial form.—rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)

Title: The Black Wolf
Synopsis: 1846: When American settlers rebel against Mexican rule in California Carlos Aceves returns from Spain to Monterey to defend his father's estate and help their friends against the subsequent invasion of American troups and ships.

Title: Ek Aur Ek Gyarah
Synopsis: A young beautiful-looking woman sells liquor while her boyfriend is stuck in prison. Its a fun masala romp with generous helpings of the recommended masala allowance. There is feisty Hirni (Zarina Wahab) who wears backless cholis and sells liquor while her smoking hot boy-friend Jaamlia (Vinod Khanna) languishes in prison. Then there is the college-going Rekha (a very subdued Neetu Singh) whose attachment to Hamlet is exemplary -- she goes to bed with it. Her hair goes from shoulder length to waist length in the space of a few moments. Perhaps that is why a visiting drunkard -- Anand (Shashi Kapoor) -- falls for her and stalks her in a bordering-on-harassment song sequence. Mahendranath (Bharat Bhushan) is a rich and lonely old man with a smarmy new manager Dilip Singh (Prem Chopra). Mahendranath had a much younger brother Rajen (the annoying kid from Fakira) - a willful brat who left home one day, never to be heard of again. Instead of heaving a sigh of "good riddance", Mahendranath keeps hoping Rajen will return. Taking advantage of the old man's hopes, Dilip hires an unemployed youth (Raza Murad), to impersonate the lost-and-now-grown-up Rajen. Mahendranath happily hands over all his property to "Rajen" and is promptly murdered by Prem. "Rajen" himself is bumped off later.Things get more complicated with new twists and thrills at every turn. Someone is sending Dilip threatening letters about Mahendranath's murder. Jaamlia is fighting off goons who land like flies in Shaitan Chowki to evict the residents. Anand makes a pact with Dilip to get Shaitan Chowki vacated. But is he tricking the residents or Dilip? While all this is happening, Rekha is mysteriously absent from the scene. After years of absence, wealthy Mahendra Nath still believes that his rebellious younger brother Rajen will return home one day. In the meantime, knowing Mahendra's weakness, plotting new manager Dilip has hatched a plan to get his hands on Nath's riches by enlisting the help of an impostor to pose as repentant Rajen. However, as greed and murderous intent take over, innocents suffer, and someone threatens to expose Dilip and his dirty secret. Who is the writer of the threatening letters? Will Dilip get what's coming to him?—Nick Riganas

Title: Something Like It
Synopsis: In a film about Rakugo, which is a traditional Japanese sit-down comedy, a man living in Tokyo is a young comic practitioner starting out. On his birthday he visits a Soapland (sexually themed bath house) for the first time. He meets 'Elizabeth' who is uninterested in Rakugo. She does like his personality, however, and they begin seeing each other and grow closer. The man visits a girls' school for work and falls in love. He discusses his emotions with Elizabeth whom he also likes. Then he meets his schoolgirl's parents and showcases his art.—aghaemi

Title: Wild Chickens
Synopsis: At the Presidential Mansion news arrives every day indicating that things in the country are going from bad to worse. The President summons all the political leaders in order to understand exactly what is happening; and yet no one can enlighten him. He decides to act. He calls two journalists and assigns them the task of investigating the matter by speaking directly with ordinary people. The investigation starts with the notorious Gypsy Tamtakos, who struggles every day for a living. Then they move on to a simple employee, Markos, who dreams of a raise -which never comes. Then it's a farmer, Thymios, who comes to the capital to sell his oranges. In a largely burlesque manner, the film more or less reveals that the entire misfortune is due to Greeks' laziness and apathy, as well as to the prevailing attitude of "no big deal".—Greek Film Archive

Title: Strike Back
Synopsis: Dave knows what it is to suffer. Especially when he takes the rap for a gang of motorbike thieves and ends up in jail. All for the love of Corinna, his beautiful girlfriend. Refused parole and nearly insane with frustration he makes a violent escape to be with her and strike back.

Title: Een vlucht regenwulpen
Synopsis:
Maarten, a bachelor living with his terminally ill mother, is haunted by a nightmare in which God tells him to lose his virginity or die within the week. He desperately tries to lose his cherry, but only succeeds in doing so after his mother finally passes away, somehow setting him free from the stifling religious atmosphere he grew up in.—Homme A. Piest <piest@pobox.leidenuniv.nl> Maarten, a Dutch biologist, had a nightmare during a stormy night. In it, he heard the voice of God, commanding him to "go forth and multiply" within one week, else he will die and be sent to hell. The nightmare is so disturbing to him that he rolled out of bed and woke up. He takes the warning seriously and resolves to try to find a woman. There's just one problem: Maarten is still a virgin, and has not yet been on even one date in all his life, despite the fact that he is 34 years old!In the morning, we see that Maarten lives in a rural area of the Netherlands, with greenhouses where he grows grapes. He still lives with his mother, who is terminally ill and has nurses on hand to take care of her. She reminds Maarten that his father was recently dead, she was not far behind, and Maarten was still single.Maarten leaves to go to his best friend Jacob's wedding, and he sees his "alter ego" (played by the same actor), and begins talking to him (to himself). This is how he goes about solving his problem. In the light of day, the nightmare seems a little bit less credible to him, and he starts making fun of it to himself - a little too much, as he stops paying attention to the road and hits another car. No one is injured, but the driver of the other car, an angry woman, demands payment for the damage. Maarten explains his problem explicitly to her, but she is unimpressed, contemptuously taking the money and driving away. Because of the delay, Maarten is the last to arrive at the wedding. While there, he thinks he sees Martha, a girl he used to know (and like).Maarten then goes to work. He is a biology professor. His alter ego, whom only he can see, encourages him to ask out his assistant Jannie, but he is too shy. Jannie hears him talking to himself, though. He almost works up the courage to try, but she leaves for lunch.Maarten goes out to lunch himself, where he sees another woman sitting at an outdoor cafe. At the encouragement of his alter ego, he goes and introduces himself to her, and describes his work in great detail. She listens politely, and then names her price: she's a prostitute! Once Maarten figures this out, he makes a hasty, embarrassed exit.Back at home after work, Maarten sees his mother's nurses taking care of her, and he has a flashback to his own days as a small boy, where one afternoon he had to go to the nearest town to see the doctor. On the way there, a journey made by boat, his mother talked to him and told him about the town, the church, and the square, things he had never seen before. Little Maarten was impressed, but he was jumpy and easily frightened. His turn to see the doctor came, where he was going to have his tonsils out. The doctor and nurses tried to comfort him, and the operation was done very swiftly and cleanly, but it still hurt. Little Maarten screamed.Back in the present day, at work the next day, Maarten once again finds it difficult to concentrate looking at Jannie. Once again appearing to work up the courage to try something, he slips and falls on scraps of paper that he dropped himself. His alter ego looks at him reproachfully, but he lost his courage again.Later that day, he goes walking in a park and sees another woman, sitting by herself, by a monument. He goes to sit down next to her and starts talking to her. She pushes the hair away from the side of her face to reveal scarring caused by a car wreck. The scarring is not terrible, and Maarten continues talking to her. She reveals that she desperately wants to find a man and have children, and, both thinking that they have found what they are looking for, they stand up. Thus Maarten discovers that she is also several inches taller than him. Once more, he loses his nerve and runs. The woman, upset and having come so close, screams and has the police put Maarten in jail. Jacob comes to bail him out.Maarten and Jacob spend the rest of the day on the lake, birdwatching, where Jacob comments on Maarten's inability to talk to women. Maarten tries to brush it off, but he inadvertently reveals his virginity to an incredulous Jacob. Jacob points at the shore, where they can see two teenagers having sex, and tells him "that is what life is all about."Maarten has another flashback to his younger days, remembering that everything Jacob told him was true: there were no other children where he was, and he always had to play alone, unless he convince his mother to play with him from time to time, and this did nothing but harm to his social development. At last, Maarten's first day of school arrives. His mother shows him the path that he will have to walk every day. At the school, Maarten meets the teacher, a soldier, and he is impressed by his uniform. The man takes kindly to Maarten, but his classmates do not, and Maarten's first interactions with other children were when they pushed, poked, and prodded him while the teacher was not looking, when they were supposed to be praying or doing their schoolwork, or when they ganged up on him after school and rolled him in the cow pies.Back at present, it's late afternoon and Maarten is heading towards Jacob's wedding reception, to be held that night. On the way there, he spots another woman riding a bicycle, who also reminds him of Martha, and, at the encouragement of his alter ego, awkwardly offers her a ride there, as they are both going to the same place. Once there, he learns from Jacob that this woman is Martha's sister Zus. He talks to her a lot during the evening, and the end of the day, she seems to be giving him lots of encouragement, but he is oblivious to it. While he is fumbling for words, she mentions an upcoming concert to him, and he agrees to come see it with her. Once he gets back in his car - alone - his alter ego berates him for missing an obvious chance, he could have bedded her that very night if he had known what to do.The next morning, Maarten is hung over, and he slips and falls down the stairs. He sees his alter ego again, and starts daydreaming about one of the domestic workers, but only succeeds in dropping a dish. He goes to see his mother one last time before leaving for Switzerland, where he is going to a biology conference.On the flight, Jacob points out a woman to Maarten, who looks carefully and sees that it's someone he knows vaguely from other biology conferences, Adrienne. He introduces her and Jacob to each other (the first words of the movie spoken in English).They arrive in Switzerland, and Maarten once more very awkwardly talks to Adrienne, taking tips from his alter ego. While there, he tries to follow his alter ego's advice, but commits a major gaffe by comparing her to Martha (the alter ego "facepalms" at this). They continue to talk, but he can't undo the mistake, he blew it. Becoming more and more uncomfortable, Maarten walks her back her hotel room but slips out at the first opportunity.
Maarten has another flashback, this time to his teen years, where he saw Martha for the first time and is immediately attracted to her, but is too shy to talk to her. Jacob showed him how easy it is, by making casual small talk, but Maarten just couldn't bring himself to say anything. His classmates, apparently not much different than when they were little, saw his difficulties, made fun of him and ganged up on him. After a fight, he escaped from the worst, but Martha made plain her disgust for the spectacle.The next day, Maarten attend the conference, and gives his speech. Afterward, he, Jacob, and Adrienne go mountain climbing. His alter ego reminds him that half of his allotted week is already gone, and Maarten is no closer now than when he started.Up in the mountains, the three walk over snow and rocks, and enjoy the spectacular Swiss scenery. The Alpine pathways are steep and uneven, making for a slow and possibly dangerous hike. On the way back down the mountain, Maarten has yet another accident, slipping and falling down a snow-covered embankment. He is knocked senseless, where he has another flashback, about talking to Martha when he was younger, and being so happy that he was even able to speak that he sang religious songs all the way home.Maarten wakes up, shaken but luckily uninjured. They return to the hotel, and Maarten has another restless night, seeing his alter ego again. He follows his alter ego, who silently shows him that he missed his chance: Adrienne is in bed with Jacob (who got married just days earlier!)Maarten returns home, and sees his alter ego everywhere now. He tries to ignore him, but he's in his mind and he can't get rid of him. The alter ego reminds him that time is passing. Maarten throws a bottle at him in frustration, but of course there is nothing really there, and he only breaks out a window in the greenhouse. That evening, he receives a two notices: two churchmen would be coming over soon to give his mother last rites, and there would be a school reunion the next day. Maarten wonders if Martha would be there.Maarten goes to the reunion, where he finally spots Martha. She is married and has three children. She tells him that she has a lot of regrets, married too young, didn't finish studying at the conservatory and had to mostly give up playing the piano, and has almost no time to herself because of her family. She introduces Maarten to her husband and children, and the husband, too, is not entirely pleased at how life has turned out for him. They start sniping at each other in front of Maarten. Martha gives Maarten a ride home, and senses that he isn't happy either. Maarten goes home, disappointed with how things turned out, and sees his alter ego once again, telling him he missed yet another chance.Towards dusk, the churchmen arrive at Maarten's house to talk to his dying mother. The men nag Maarten about not having been to church himself much lately. Maarten makes excuses, but soon admits that he no longer believes. His mother admits much the same to the shocked churchmen. They pray, but the prayer sounds barbaric to Maarten. When he can finally listen no more, he freaks out and throws the churchmen bodily out the front door. The men vow to pray for divine punishment against Maarten. Maarten, further enraged, throws one of them into the canal, and pronounces Christianity a lie, and life a joke.Maarten goes back inside and turns on the radio for his mother, and has another flashback to when he was a young man. His father, a strict Calvinist, didn't want him to listen to the radio, but his mother didn't seem to mind. Maarten announced his intention to attend a different church that day, which also doesn't sit well with his father. His mother knows exactly why he wanted to go to the other church. Martha went there. No sooner had Maarten arrived there and sat down near her, than she walked away, to go to another part of the church, to sit with another man (her future husband.)During the night, as Maarten sat up with her, his mother died. The next day was the last day Maarten was allotted in his nightmare at the beginning. The doctors take the body away, and Maarten disassembles his mother's bed. He drives towards town (passing the same place where he had the car wreck near the beginning). It's Sunday, and he remembers he was going to see a concert with Zus. They walk by the ponds, into the park, where he tells her a little about his work. They stop in at his laboratory briefly, return to the park, and, at length, back to his greenhouse. He tells her that he comes from a long line of grape farmers, and he continues to tend the grapes as a hobby and a tribute to his ancestors.They go back into his house and have dinner, and this time Maarten seizes his opportunity. Although Zus still has to give him some encouragement, he figures it out and shortly afterward, they are having sex. Maarten has finally broken the curse and beaten the deadline

Title: Es peligroso casarse a los 60
Synopsis: A recently-married old man with no descendants is notified he's a father when his offspring becomes an "orphan". He welcomes the news of having a child with great joy and decides to bring his progeny home immediately.

Title: Girgiriye
Synopsis: A bear-leading gypsy from the slums struggles to get back his sweetheart who works for a pavilion runner in the city, until she feels a wistful longing for where she thinks she is belong to and turns recalcitrant against the pavilion runner.—Victorydawn Pictures

Title: Asphalt
Synopsis: Heavy traffic in the summer. Bad luck for Juliet, Albert, Jaeger and Arthur who does not reach their destination. Involved in a terrible accident that will change their lives forever.

Title: Bhavni Bhavai
Synopsis: The atrocities on lower caste people displayed using folklore and ancient kingdom story. The digging of a step well in drought prone area and the exploitation of its lower caste people by the kingdom in a satirical manner.

Title: Balbeero Bhabi
Synopsis: The film was based on a real-life story, which later became a famous folk tale. It was a story about honor killing.

Title: Brujas mágicas
Synopsis: In the year 1595, in a Spanish village lives the miller Diego, irresistible to the local girls. Meanwhile, a friar arrives in the village on his way to Santiago de Compostela, and is mistaken for a man sent by the Inquisition.

Title: Los liantes
Synopsis: Spain, in the early eighties. Fidel, Amador and Eduardo form a group of scammers. One day they know a very superstitious man who believes that there is "the elephant man", a man of good luck, and they plan the scam of their lives.

Title: Delitto al ristorante cinese
Synopsis: The officer Nico Giraldi investigates a homicide which has taken place in a Chinese restaurant in Rome. His wife and his son are kidnappeded by the murderer in the course of the inquiry. In the end the case is worked out.—Piergiorgio Romani <p.romani@flashnet.it>

Title: Ach du lieber Harry
Synopsis: Harry App is a private detective with only one goal: bring the priceless rabbit Mister Theo alive and well to Switzerland. Harry App is a private detective, but his office has a chronic lack of customers. The old lady Anni Rose offers him a deal which is lucrative and at the same time seems easy to accomplish. App needs to take the priceless breeding rabbit Mister Theo to Switzerland, where the animal will participate in a competition. The road to Switzerland is however more treacherous than App thinks.—Arnoud Tiele (imdb@tiele.nl)

Title: Setinggan
Synopsis: Life isn't always better in the city. Sudin moves his family to the city in search of a better life. Once there, they encounter endless problems including supernatural disturbances to their house and community. In the end, it would seem that life was better in the village after all.—mahajanssen

Title: Maan Gaye Ustaad
Synopsis: Chandan Singh is a farmer who lives in a village called Ramgarh along with his wife, Malti, and two children, Munna and Munni. One day Malti gets molested by three city goons, Jaikishan, Rajan, and Banoo. Chandan intervenes, but is attacked, and Malti is shot dead. The children get separated, while Munna is adopted by a Muslim male named Abba and is re-named Shera, Munni is adopted by a Hindu family and re-named Geeta. Years later the three estranged family members are fated to meet again - this time Geeta is a con-woman, who has a con-man boyfriend, Kishan, who is on the lookout for the man who killed his photographer brother, and believes that Chandan is the killer; while Chandan, who is now known as Chandan Dada, a hoodlum, has been arrested for killing a man named Rajan; while Shera, a hit-man and hoodlum himself, has feigned his arrest, after accepting a contract from none other than Jaikishan - to kill Chandan!!—rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)

Title: Langit Tidak Selalu Cerah
Synopsis: A wife, Huzaimah who is crazy about rank and luxury is willing to leave her husband who lives a simple life and their young child. He uses his artistic talent to achieve his dream and succeeds in achieving it with the help and encouragement of Armali and his other friends. But she was tricked by the sweet-talking Jeff. His career as a singer is over and now he is stuck in the valley of prostitution. After being abandoned by Jeff, whom she thought was her lover, she began to realize her mistake and tried to return to the bottom of the road. Her first step is to find her husband and child that she left behind. But unfortunately, he was diagnosed with HIV. Meanwhile, Amran and Murni have started a new life with Rohana and Mak Mah by running a food stall in the village. Although Huzaimah has met Amran and Murni but it is too late Amran's heart has been closed to forgive Huzaimah. After Huzaimah saved Murni from falling into the gorge. Only then did Amran forgive Huzaimah after being persuaded by Rohana. Huzaimah had time to repent and maybe she recovered from her illness.

Title: L'amour nu
Synopsis: An educated woman ,with good prospects falls in love with an oceanographer .But breast cancer strikes : will she remain a true woman ,in spite of a mastectomy?

Title: Da Di Du
Synopsis: Tells the story of three friends Badu, Badi and Bada who have just met due to a past story that is not on one side so they decide to study with Tok Guru and after the training is over they return to their hometown for revenge.

Title: Freddie of the Jungle
Synopsis: An enterprising woman reporter enlists the help of a hardened African explorer to try to locate a missing showbiz man who disappeared some time ago.

Title: Ram Lakshman
Synopsis: Lakshman, an elephant, and Ram are inseparable friends. Ram even refuses to marry Meena when her father insists on getting rid of Lakshman. When Ram is accused of murder, Lakshman comes to his rescue.

Title: La niña de la mochila azul 2
Synopsis: Amy and her friend Raúl travel to an island in search of a treasure that belonged to the pirate Red Beard. Along the way, they face many adventures and dangers.

Title: Ogo Bodhu Sundari
Synopsis: Suspicion arises as a married person brings a tomboy in his home.

Title: El gran perro muerto
Synopsis: In a small town, a dead dog on the middle of the main street, then a bureaucratic process begins to determine who is responsible for removing dead dog. The tranquility of a small town is disrupted by the presence of a dead dog, which lays in the middle of the main street, as local authorities are unable to agree who's responsible of removing the dog's remains and then the federal government intervenes, however the rotting carcass continues on the street because no government agency assume the task because bureaucratic dispositions.—jairhcastillo

Title: The Gate of Hell
Synopsis: Kitty, Kenny and a group of their friends decide to go camping in an area known as "Devil's Peak." What follows is a dark night of terror, panic, abandonment and ultimate betrayal as the forces of evil are unleashed on the entire group. Kitty (Ying Li), Kenny (Tao Hung Li) and eight of their friends decide to go camping in an area of Hong Kong's northern countryside known as "Devil's Peak." They leave their vehicles and continue on foot. While making their way up the hillside, they are confronted by an odd-looking local character who asks whether they are not afraid to continue as there is something terrible ahead. They dismiss his warnings as those of a madman and press on. As darkness sets in, they find a clearing where they have a barbecue and pitch their tents for the night.During the night, Kitty and Kenny are awakened by a violent thunderstorm, and are shocked to discover that their companions are nowhere to be found. They begin a search for them but, with a howling wind and heavy rain beginning to fall, they are forced to take shelter in an old abandoned mansion. Kitty is sure that the house had not been there in the daytime, but Kenny reasons that she must have just failed to notice it among the trees. The front doors of the mansion are locked shut and a large wooden cross has been chained across them. There seems to be no way of gaining access, but they then notice the base of the doors have partially rotted away, and they manage to crawl through a small hole.Once inside they can only see with the aid of Kenny's cigarette lighter as they make their way through the derelict building. They discover an old candle and ignite it before the fuel in the lighter runs out. The extra illumination reveals a huge portrait on the wall of the great hall. It is a stern, powerful-looking Caucasian man dressed in very old-fashioned attire. They reason that he must have been the owner of the house more than a hundred years ago. The picture looks so frightening that they both begin to get a bad feeling about the house, but count themselves lucky that they at least have shelter from the storm. Kenny breaks up some old sticks of furniture and makes a fire so they can get warm and dry. But Kitty cannot help worrying about their six friends who are out somewhere in the bad weather. Kenny tells her there is no way they can search for them until daylight when hopefully the storm will have passed. They settle down on a sofa in front of the fire and soon fall asleep. As they do, the storm gradually abates and the full moon appears between the dark clouds. The sound of wolves howling can be heard.Down in the cellar, something strange is happening. It is empty apart from an old coffin with a cross placed on top of the lid. A large snake is hanging from the ceiling and is dripping blood from its mouth onto the coffin below. The drops of blood trickle through a crack in the lid, and splash onto the skull of the corpse within. As more blood seeps in, a transformation takes place and little by little the lifeless bones grow sinew and flesh. It is soon clear that lying within the coffin is the reanimated and rejuvenated body of the vampire, Count Dracula (Warwick Paul Evans). Because the cross lying on top of the coffin is preventing his escape, Dracula attempts to dislodge it by banging on the lid from within.Kitty is awakened by the distant banging noises echoing up from the depths of the mansion and tries to rouse Kenny, without success. She takes the candle and goes to find where the sound is coming from. Upon reaching the cellar, she gingerly approaches the coffin. Dracula immediately senses her presence and becomes silent. At this point the snake falls from the ceiling and wraps itself around Kitty's shoulders, causing her to cry out to Kenny to come to her aid. He arrives and manages to wrestle the snake away from her, but in the ensuing struggle the tail of the snake flicks the cross away from the coffin and onto the floor. After dealing with the snake, the pair decide to leave but are shocked when their path is blocked by Dracula who is by this time standing near the foot of the cellar steps. Kitty recognizes the vampire's face as being identical to the one they earlier saw in the picture. Dracula attempts to hypnotize Kenny but is interrupted by Kitty who warns him not to stare into the vampire's eyes. Dracula informs them that he is their master and they must obey his commands and stay in the house to serve him. Kenny refuses and begins to leave with Kitty, but Dracula warns them that without his permission they will not be able to leave the grounds of the mansion.The pair go past him and are halfway up the stairs when Dracula flies through the air and lands at the top of the steps, blocking the exit. With a blood-curdling growl, he leaps at Kenny's throat and knocks him to the floor. They struggle as Dracula ties to bite his neck, but Kenny manages to stand up and push him away. When Kitty asks Dracula what he wants, he responds that they must immediately carry out an important task. Kitty says they will do it on condition that afterwards they will be set free. Dracula agrees and commands them to follow him from the cellar. As they leave, Kitty reveals to Kenny that she knows about the history of vampires and that Dracula must be from Transylvania.Dracula leads them through the house but turns to give them an angry look when he sees the sticks of furniture burning in the middle of the great hall. The couple look guilty and worried. He then leads them into the courtyard and round to the rear of the house. Along the way, they notice the grounds have very high walls which would be impossible to climb. At last they reach a side room leading off from the rear courtyard and Dracula instructs them to go inside. On entering, they are startled to see the room is full of coffins, each with a cross placed upon its lid. They are ordered to gather all the crosses and throw them out of the room and they will be set free. Kenny is about to comply, but Kitty warns him that each coffin must contain a vampire and if they remove the crosses the vampires will all emerge and the couple will never escape. She tells him that Dracula is afraid of crosses and that's why he wants to make use of Kenny and her to remove them and release all the vampires.Kitty suggests they grab one of the crosses to fend Dracula off while they make their escape. At that moment Dracula becomes impatient and threatens to attack, and Kenny quickly picks up a cross and chases Dracula out of the room, following in hot pursuit. Kitty calls out to him, but he ignores her and leaves her on her own among the coffins. Not knowing what to do, she waits in the courtyard for his return. Suddenly there is an ungodly groaning noise followed by a loud shriek as Kitty is set upon by a female vampire (Emma Amelie), a bride of Dracula, who had been released because of the cross removed by Kenny. He returns just in time to prevent Kitty from being bitten, and chases Dracula's bride away by threatening her with the cross. This time he stays with Kitty and apologizes for leaving her, but she is angry with him and accuses him of not caring about her. He says they should now make their escape, using the cross to fend off any attacks.The rear courtyard has two paths leading back to the front but both become blocked when metal gates suddenly slide shut and lock themselves automatically. They have no choice but to follow the path at the back of the house, but the high hedge there only has steep cliffs on the other side. Kitty says their only option is to go back to the house, retracing their steps, and go through the hole in the front door. There is another hedge separating the rear courtyard from the house so their only way back is to climb over. Kenny hands the cross to Kitty, climbs to the top of the high hedge and stretches his hand out so Kitty can follow. When she reaches the top, he jumps down to the ground on the other side and asks her to do likewise but she refuses saying it's too high. He tells her to turn herself around and come down feet first, but in so doing she accidentally lets go of the cross and it falls to the other side of the hedge. At that precise moment, and before they have time to retrieve it, Dracula appears and Kenny tells Kitty to make a run for it while he tries to buy time. Kenny runs off in the other direction and Dracula chases after him. In the ensuing battle, Kenny is eventually defeated, hypnotized and bitten by the vampire.Kitty, who had been reluctant to leave without Kenny, has been waiting nearby and on hearing his scream races to look for him. She finds him lying on the ground and when she turns his head to one side, she sees he has been bitten on the neck. Kenny then opens his eyes and draws his lips back over his teeth to reveal two large fangs. Unsure of what to do, she gingerly backs away only to find Dracula standing behind her. She then makes a desperate run for it, pursued by both Dracula and Kenny who is now a vampire. She makes it back to the house where she manages to keep one step ahead of her pursuers by hiding in corners and under furniture. She then remembers the cross which had been knocked from Dracula's coffin by the snake, and decides her best chance is to try and retrieve it.Kitty arrives at the cellar but as she enters she is shocked to find her six missing friends lying in a row on the floor. She thinks they are merely sleeping but then notices bite marks on all their necks. At this point they wake up, show their fangs and then suddenly all sit upright. She recoils in horror and backs away, but is shocked to find Dracula's bride standing behind her. She makes a break for the staircase but three of her erstwhile friends block her path. It seems she is surrounded but she cleverly grabs the large candle and uses the flame as a weapon to ward them off and clear a path out of the cellar. They all run after her as she dashes back through the house towards the front door. Before she can reach it, Dracula and Kenny appear ahead of her, so she runs up upstairs and enters a room on the upper floor. She hides under a wicker basket but is discovered and runs out of the room only to be cornered by some of the other vampires, including Dracula, on the gallery overlooking the great hall. She has to resort to crawling onto a plank of wood, jutting precariously over the edge and falls to the floor beneath, swiftly followed by Dracula who jumps down after her. The impact kicks up a huge cloud of dust, but when this clears Dracula is the only one to emerge. Kitty is nowhere to be seen.As Dracula kisses his bride in a ghastly and protracted ritual embrace, the others all hunt for Kitty looking in every nook and cranny. She is nearly at the front door, and remembers there is a cross fixed to the outside of it. She makes a bold move to quickly crawl though the hole but is grabbed by the legs before she can make it all the way through. As they continue tugging, she reaches up trying to get the cross but the door gives way and collapses inward under the stress and she is exposed to the demonic glare of Dracula. He flies at her like a bat ready for a feast but she manages to get the cross and plunge it into his torso, sending him into a frenzy of excruciating pain. This seems to affect all the other vampires too as they mirror his agonized contortions. But it is not to last. Dracula makes the manages to pull the cross from his body, and throws it onto the ground. Kitty runs for her life.Although temporarily weakened, Dracula's powers over the others remains strong and he signals them to run after Kitty and bring her back. As fast as she can, Kitty runs down the hillside to where her car is parked, but is immediately besieged by vampires who smash the windscreen and attempt to get in. She responds by plunging a knife between the eyes of one of them, before driving off at high speed and running down another. In her panic to get away, she later crashes the car against a tree.Waking up in hospital the following morning, she is suffering so much from the trauma of the previous night that she is unable to make much sense to anybody and keeps asking for a priest. The hospital staff call Father Tong (Bill Lake), who arrives at the same time as a police detective who is anxious to interrogate Kitty over the two dead bodies on the hillside. Father Tong assumes Kitty wishes to confess her guilt and seek forgiveness, but instead she shocks everybody by saying that she went to a house that was full of vampires. The policeman is unconvinced, but Father Tong takes her story seriously and lends her a small crucifix on a chain.That night Dracula comes to the hospital, gaining access via the staircase leading up to the balcony. In the darkness he silently approaches Kitty's bedside and prepares to strike. His customary blood-curdling growl, however, alerts Kitty to the danger and she lunges at his throat with the crucifix. It lodges in the collar of Dracula's shirt just under his chin and its mere presence is enough to send him recoiling in agony. It is now apparent that Kenny has also infiltrated the hospital room, as his shoes are visible poking out from beneath a screen. Dracula quivers and writhes with discomfort but eventually the crucifix dislodges itself from his collar and falls to the floor. He prepares once more to attack Kitty but Kenny springs out of hiding and beats him to it, determined to have her for himself.The lights in the room are suddenly switched on to reveal that Kenny has bitten Kitty on the neck. The brightness of the lights cause Kitty and Kenny to collapse but Dracula remains standing, although in obvious discomfort. His attention is then drawn to the presence of Father Tong standing by the door who tells him that he is going to destroy him. Dracula immediately recovers his composure and prepares to attack but is rebuffed when Father Tong suddenly produces a large and very sharp wooden stake. The boot is on the other foot as Dracula is put on the defensive and a fight to the finish ensues, priest against vampire. It continues with Dracula ultimately being impaled by the stake and being wrestled onto the balcony. Dracula finally retreats from the battle by jumping over the edge and disappearing.The bodies of Kitty and Kenny are placed side by side on the hospital bed, taken down in the lift and wheeled across to the mortuary. But on the way, they suddenly both sit bolt upright, baring their fangs.Kitty now wakes up back in her tent at the camp-site. Kenny asks her what's wrong and she tells him she has been having a nightmare. Kenny says it is morning now and time to get up. They still have to explore Devil's Peak. The events of the previous night were just in her imagination - or were they?

Title: Main Aur Mera Hathi
Synopsis: This is a Story of DSP Kumar who gets an Elephant whom they call Laxman for his son Ram in his childhood. Kumar sends his son away for further studies as when he is with Laxman he is always doing mischief. The boy grows up as "Mithun". Ram falls in love with Meenu "Poonam Dhillon". One day when Kumar is at Meenu's house to talk to her mum about their marriage he sees Vicky "Sharat Saxena", who used to be a goon. Vicky goes back and tells his partner Tejaa "Suresh Oberoi" and they both come back to kill Ram's dad. After that both Ram and Laxman track both Vick and Tejaa to take revenge, as Laxman has seen the murder. Raaka "Mahendra Sandhu" whos is Meenu's brother also helps them in this cause.—asimbhatti191 Wrongly imprisoned for a crime he did not commit in his youth, Ram's seeks vengeance against Teja. Upon his release from prison, Ram changes his name to Raj, and gets employed by Teja. Teja finds out that Ram loves Julie, and goes to meet her, only to find out that she does not know any man by the name of Ram, and when shown a photograph, she identifies him as Raj. Angry with Ram for concealing his true identity, and for attempting to avenge himself, Teja has Ram imprisoned, and the only one who can save Ram is an elephant.—rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)

Title: The Dozens
Synopsis: A young woman (Debra Margolies) just out of prison tries to make a new life in Boston.

Title: A Hard Nut to Crack
Synopsis: A cartoonist overcomes his jealousy towards his wife's psychoanalyst by killing him in one of his strips. When the doctor is found dead, the police start an investigation and seek the cartoonist first.

Title: Munnettam
Synopsis: Two friends, Rajappan and Chandran, have different personalities. While Rajappan leads an honest life, Chandran abandons his girlfriend after she gets pregnant but ends up paying a huge price.

Title: Fiffty Fiffty
Synopsis: Bihari is jealous of his rich relative, Virendra Singh, and swaps his son with his own, Kishan. Kishan eventually grows up to become a burglar. Thakur Virendra Singh lives a wealthy lifestyle in India along with his wife and a son, Kumar. His relative Bihari is envious, and successfully switches his son, Kishan, with Kumar, and also ends up killing Virendra. In this manner, Kumar grows up a wealthy lifestyle, while Kishan lives a poor lifestyle, shunned by his father and his mother, who has lost the use of her vocal chords. Bihari takes Kishan to his brother in Bombay, and leaves him there to lead a life of crime. 20 years later, Kishan has grown up and is now a master burglar. He meets with another burglar, Mary, and both decide to be fifty fifty partners. However, Mary has other plans, she ditches Kishan and joins forces with Diwan Shamsher Singh to masquerade as the long-lost daughter of Ranimaa of Chandpur. Mary does not know that it was the Diwan who has done away with Rajkumari Ratna, and he will not hesitate to kill Mary - or anyone else who dares to stand in his way and the treasure of Chandpur.—rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)

Title: The Intruder
Synopsis: An entertainer arrives to put on a show in a small town. It turns out that he has mystical powers that give each person a glowing aura, and forces them to tell the truth. Complications ensue.

Title: Was kostet der Sieg?
Synopsis: A school in Vienna is invited to a football tournament. The gym teacher and the selected students in the school's football team take it all very seriously. So serious that they become ambitious and put pleasure and friendship at stake.

Title: Stark Raving Mad
Synopsis: While awaiting execution, a convicted serial killer relates the story of the circumstances that led to his present situation.

Title: Gambler's Delight
Synopsis: A gambler named Dragon is hired by a casino in Macau to investigate Madam Jin, a mysterious woman who has been cleaning out the local gaming establishments.

Title: Kanhaiyaa
Synopsis: Sharda lives a wealthy lifestyle along with her widower dad, Thakur Ranvir Singh, in Bombay, India. She incurs her dad's displeasure when she gets elopes and gets married to Jaichand Prakash, who is poor. She gets pregnant and Jaichand passes away, leaving her to give birth to Kanhaiyaa. When he gets to be 9 years of age, an ailing Sharda too passes away, compelling Kanhaiyaa to live in the Bal Kalyan Anarthalay, run by a cruel Manager, Makhanlal, and his equally cruel wife, Radha. When Kanhaiyaa is abused, beaten, and starved, he escapes, ends up in Bombay, straight into the clutches of Madhav Singh and Rahim, who house several male orphans and train them to be petty thieves. Kanhaiyaa does not want to steal but is compelled to join the gang. One day he gets beaten-up, but ends up being looked after by none other then his estranged grandfather, who comes to know of his identity, and is thrilled to have him back. But Kanhaiyaa's problems are far from over for he is abducted by Madhav's gang, and taken back to their hideout. When Madhav finds out that there is a reward of ten thousand Rupees being offered by Ranvir, he decides to return Kanhaiyaa. A much relieved Kanhaiyaa looks forward to being re-united with his grandfather little knowing that Ranvir's nephew, Pratap, has other plans for him.—rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)

Title: Tonkei shinjû
Synopsis: Pig Chicken Suicide is a veritable assault on the senses, mixing violent images of animal slaughter, racial strife and surrealism to tell the story of two Koreans living in Japan who's love is destroyed due to overwhelming racial discrimination.—patriot

Title: Jwaala Daaku
Synopsis: Ravi would like to study medicine and then come back and practice it in his small town where there is no doctor or medical facility available for miles. Encouraged by the townspeople and his brother, Bankhe, he re-locates to Bombay, where in a few years time he is able to successfully complete his studies and become a doctor. When he returns home, nothing is the same anymore. His brother Bankhe is absconding, running away from Daku Jwala, who has sworn to kill him to avenge his brother's death - and Dr. Ravi himself has to face Jwala sooner or later - as Jwala's vengeance includes Bankhe and all of his family. Dr. Ravi must now make up his mind to look death at the hands of an angry Jwala - or re-locate and practice medicine elsewhere.—rAjOo (gunwanti@hotmail.com)

Title: Odnazhdy dvadtsat let spustya
Synopsis: After 20 years classmates get together and discuss their unfulfilled dreams and unmet goals.

Title: Sankharsham
Synopsis: Sangarsham is a 1981 Indian Malayalam film, directed by P G Viswambaram produced by Renji Mathew. The film stars Sukumaran, Ratheesh and Seema in lead roles. Music of the film was composed by Sankar Ganesh.

Title: Female Teacher Rope Hell
Synopsis: Sayuri, a female teacher, is abducted, imprisoned and tortured by a pervert.

Title: El gran triunfo
Synopsis: Rigo Tovar y su conjunto Costa Azul triunfan en un importante teatro. Su representante no desea compartir las ganancias y por ello inventa que Rigo tiene una relación con Rosita Montes.

Title: Seethakoka Chilaka
Synopsis: Seethakoka Chilaka 1981 Indian Telugu film, Directed by P. Bharathiraja and Produced Poornodaya. The film Stars Karthik, Mucherla Aruna, Sarath Babu, Jaggaiah, Master Ali, Smitha and Dubbing Janaki lead roles. The music of the film was composed by Ilayaraja.

Title: Con el rabo entre las piernas
